item.title: 2019-nCoV Epidemic Mitigation Time Forecast (2020-02-10)
item.description: Time trends and model predictions of confirmed cases across the country Our model shows that the national epidemic situation will ease on 02-23 (the number of confirmed cases will not increase significantly). On 2020-02-10 there will be 2035 new confirmed cases and in total 41856 confirmed cases. National Epidemic Time Series Date Confirmed Suspected Severe Dead Cured Conf.+Susp. Incr.

On 2020-02-05 there will be 1079 new confirmed cases and in total 26674 confirmed cases. National Epidemic Time Series Date Confirmed Suspected Severe Dead Cured Conf.+Susp. Incr.

On 2020-02-04 there will be 551 new confirmed cases and in total 22471 confirmed cases. National Epidemic Time Series Date Confirmed Suspected Severe Dead Cured Conf.+Susp. Incr.

item.title: 2019-nCoV Epidemic Data Download
item.description: We collect several ways to get the 2019-nCoV epidemic data. Use the R ncovr package R users can get the epidemic data via the ncovr package we develop, which basically includes the datasets described later. # Install the remotes package install.packages('remotes') # Install the ncovr package remotes::install_github('pzhaonet/ncovr') # windows users have to set the Chinese environment Sys.setlocale('LC_CTYPE', 'Chinese') # Load the ncovr package require("ncovr") # read RDS data (default；recommended) get_ncov() # read .

item.title: About
item.description: This is the website for information of 2019-nCoV outbreak. WeChat official account Project Homepage If you have any suggestions for this project, please feel free to submit an issue to the project homepage: https://github.com/pzhaonet/ncov The Laiyindata Team ZHAO Peng ZOU Yi WANG Xiaoxiang HAN Lei Contact <openr(at)pzhao.net> Acknowledgments R ncovr package is used for data processing and visualization. The data used on this site come from BlankerL/DXY-2019-nCoV-Crawler and JackieZheng/2019-nCoV.

item.title: Overview of 2019-nCoV
item.description: Introduction of the virus Virus Type: New Coronavirus 2019-nCoV Source of infection: patients who are already with new coronavirus infection. Asymptomatic patients can also be contagious. Ways of Transmission: Respiratory droplets and contact transmission are the main ways of transmission. Other transmission ways such as aerosol and digestive tract are yet to be confirmed. Vulnerable population: Generally susceptible to all population. Elderly people and those with chronic diseases are more sick after infection.
